title: closed() method apparently doesn't exist
body:
by **viniciuspontocom**: 
Before filing a bug, please check whether it has been fixed since
the latest release: run "hg pull -u" and retry what you did to
reproduce the problem.  Thanks.

What steps will reproduce the problem?
1.go to http://golang.org/doc/play/
2.on the 'examples' drop down menu, select 'Tree Comparison'
3.click 'COMPILE AND RUN'

What is the expected output?
A tree comparison, or some output related to the example showed.

What do you see instead?
The following message:
"prog.go:55: undefined: closed
 prog.go:56: undefined: closed"

Which compiler are you using (5g, 6g, 8g, gccgo)?
whichever one is being used on the test page

Which operating system are you using?
RHEL 6

Which revision are you using?  (hg identify)


Please provide any additional information below.
As I went over the test page, I stumbled across this issue. It might be a small syntax
or declaration missing problem.
I'm not sure if this is the right place to report the issue, but I didn't find any
documentation which would allow me to troubleshoot or fix the problem.
